comments.body:
As an alternative approach, I considered adding a `toEnvironment()` function to the `MlflowHostCreds` interface. Extending the interface, however, would needlessly break existing third-party code which may extend this class. Further, this is the only instance in the Java Client where host credentials are mapped to environment variables + it's unclear that `toEnvironment()` meshes well with the existing `MlflowHostCreds` abstraction.

Accordingly, I think this approach is better. Feel free to chime in with pushback!
Add experimental warning here too? Since the class and its methods do show up public docs (e.g. https://mlflow.org/docs/0.5.2/java_api/org/mlflow/artifacts/CliBasedArtifactRepository.html)

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +146,150 @@   * This api may change or be removed in a future release without warning.
   *
   * Only available in the CliBasedArtifactRepository. Downloads an artifact to the local
   * filesystem when provided with an artifact uri. This method should not be used directly
   * by the user. Please use {@link org.mlflow.tracking.MlflowClient}

comments.body: I think we're trying to rename `runUuid` to `runId` everywhere per @mateiz's hope. The protobuf may be the last to go, though.

Since this is asynchronous, can we have built in retries. Esp for server busy or not found error codes? This can be an optional retry counter, for instance. This is not a blocking comment, something to consider.
Shouldn't the retries be within `mlflow artifacts download`, etc? This method is just forking a process, and that process should probably take care to work well.
